messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: *AARRGGHHH*, when I was little my nickname was *Missy Prissy* and *Prissy Pants* ... *ACK*, I LOATHED BOTH names but too bad for me b/c both fit me
messages.messageBody:
*AARRGGHHH*, when I was little my nickname was *Missy Prissy* and *Prissy
Pants* ... *ACK*, I LOATHED BOTH names but too bad for me b/c both fit me
*PERFECTLY*!!! nowdays, I just go by Pris, Priscilla is just TOO LONG to
say and type; bascially lazy, don't you know ... my fm gets a big kick out
of it when they hear my mother or sisters use those names;
***UHHHhhhhhhHOOOOOOoooooo MISSSYYYYYYY PRISSYYYYYYYYYY*** ... ***hey ya
PRISSY PANTS*** ... of course then they'd BETTER START RUNNING!!! haha

Pris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: Bridget, She sounds so precious!  I thought of those cute Boyd s Bears when I read her nickname!  :)  ~Karen
messages.messageBody:
Bridget, She sounds so precious! I thought of those cute Boyd's Bears when I

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: it depends, I guess.  My nickname (which is my ICQ screen name) is Troggers, cos a friend at school had had a friend at the previous school called Tracy
messages.messageBody:
it depends, I guess. My nickname (which is my ICQ screen
name) is Troggers, cos a friend at school had had a friend at the
previous school called Tracy Hoggers, so she got called troggers,
and so did I. Considering the stereotypes connected with 'Tracy'
(or Tracey) and awful way it sounds out loud (especially with an
accent) I had NO problem with this!

Tracy
PS, It always depends on the intent, I guess.

On 19 Jun 2000, at 13:20, cen46624@... wrote:

Hmmm....I'm seeing a pattern here. Nicknames assigned
by family and others 
who loves us are fun, and nicknames assigned by school
peers tend not to be 
fun.

:-) Diane

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: Heather used to be sweet-pea, haven t used that for a while, and Abigail s Abi anyway, but they re collectively known as the sprouts.  I used to call abi
messages.messageBody:
Heather used to be 'sweet-pea,' haven't used that for a while, and
Abigail's 'Abi' anyway, but they're collectively known as the
sprouts. I used to call abi 'sprout' and she'd say 'I'm not a sprout,
I'm an Abi!'

Tracy

the bunny boy-jeremiah 
is bingoand emma is bearcub or emmabean!
bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: My son Alex is Ackie, because that is how he said his name when he was 2. Once he looked at his name that I had written and said A-L-E-X spells Ackie!
messages.messageBody:
My son Alex is Ackie, because that is how he said his name when he was 2.
Once he looked at his name that I had written and said "A-L-E-X spells
Ackie!"
~Shelley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: karen, we called her emmabear because she was so fierce right from the get-go when she wanted or didn t want something-hated clothes-changing and loved
messages.messageBody:
karen,
we called her emmabear because she was so fierce right from the get-go when
she wanted or didn't want something-hated clothes-changing and loved
nursing-usual stuff but she would roar and stiffen up her whole body-so funny
to see her with her tiny fists clenched in rage. the homebirth midwife we had
said she had a temper the second after she was born and she was right. to top
it off, emma refused to wear anything but the gap *bear *booties my mom got
her for her first birthday till we couldn't squeeze them on anymore. now she
insists on wearing her "pitty" (pretty) shoes-white t-strap sandals. she is a
character.
bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: Bridget, I think Emmabear is such a cute name!  ~Karen
messages.messageBody: Bridget, I think Emmabear is such a cute name! ~Karen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: Hmmm....I m seeing a pattern here. Nicknames assigned by family and others who loves us are fun, and nicknames assigned by school peers tend not to be fun.
messages.messageBody:
Hmmm....I'm seeing a pattern here. Nicknames assigned by family and others
who loves us are fun, and nicknames assigned by school peers tend not to be
fun.

:-) Diane

is bingoand emma is bearcub or emmabean!

Sam. For her birthday last year her dad wrapped up a can of Spam for her
... you'd've thought she'd died and gone to heaven she loved the gift
sooooo much!!!

>>
How cute! :) ~Karen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/18/00 11:43:48 PM Central Daylight Time, JustMOMThanks@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/18/00 11:43:48 PM Central Daylight Time,
JustMOMThanks@... writes:

<< but sweet nothing names are so
much fun...within the family, of course...She's Briana to everyone but Shel
>>
I think so, too. I often call my daughter, McKenna, "Muffin". I don't know
where it came from, it just sort of happened. :) My oldest son calls her
"Sweet little punkin pie" all the time. I think it's cute, but I can
certainly understand Dia's feelings since had some bad experiences
personally. I was never "Katrina" to anyone but my mom, who still calls me
that occasionally. ~Karen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: ... We used to call the oldest our little * puke * . When she was born the Doc said one more push, I said * basin!!! * and promptly threw up while pushing the
messages.messageBody:
JustMOMThanks@... wrote:
>
> Kids can be cruel. Sometimes, I call Briana "Bri" for short...and I call my
> husband "Shel" (short for Shelton) and I go by "Jo" (obviously short for
> JoAnna). We just do it because it's fun. My grandmother told me that her
> parents called her "dump" - short for dumpling (she was born weighing 4
> pounds). They never called her anything but "dump" unless she was in
> trouble...then they called her Janice. I call Briana "piglet" or "my little
> breastfed baby". I think names have a place...but sweet nothing names are so
> much fun...within the family, of course...She's Briana to everyone but Shel
> and I.
>
> JoAnna

We used to call the oldest our little * puke * . When she was born the
Doc said one more push, I said * basin!!! * and promptly threw up while
pushing the last push. When she was a little older we started
affectionately calling her our little toad ... picked that one up from a
British comedy ( Good Neighbours ).

Nathan has always been * Monkey boy * because he was always undressing
himself as fast as we dressed him on the change table ... undressing
himself with his feet that is.

Samantha has the nick name of * Spam * simply because it rhymes with
Sam. For her birthday last year her dad wrapped up a can of Spam for her
... you'd've thought she'd died and gone to heaven she loved the gift
sooooo much!!!

Buzz
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Klement Family "Education is what survives when
Darryl, Debbie, what has been learned has been
Kathleen, Nathan & forgotten"
Samantha B.F. Skinner in "New Scientist".
e-mail- klement@...
Canadian homeschool page: http:\\www.flora.org/homeschool-ca/
Ont. Federation of Teaching Parents: http:\\www.flora.org/oftp/
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: Kids can be cruel.  Sometimes, I call Briana Bri for short...and I call my husband Shel (short for Shelton) and I go by Jo (obviously short for JoAnna).
messages.messageBody:
Kids can be cruel. Sometimes, I call Briana "Bri" for short...and I call my
husband "Shel" (short for Shelton) and I go by "Jo" (obviously short for
JoAnna). We just do it because it's fun. My grandmother told me that her
parents called her "dump" - short for dumpling (she was born weighing 4
pounds). They never called her anything but "dump" unless she was in
trouble...then they called her Janice. I call Briana "piglet" or "my little
breastfed baby". I think names have a place...but sweet nothing names are so
much fun...within the family, of course...She's Briana to everyone but Shel
and I.

JoAnna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] nicknames
messages.msgSnippet: My mother used to hate it when my brother shortened me to Di. This was before Princess Di, of course. My mother heard Die. When I named my kids I tried to
messages.messageBody:
My mother used to hate it when my brother shortened me to "Di." This was
before Princess Di, of course. My mother heard "Die."

When I named my kids I tried to choose names with acceptable nicknames: Brian
and Katherine.

:-) Diane

> I have never liked nicknames, and have never shortened my kids names to
> anything. Probably stems from being called "Dia Pia Diahrreah" throughout
> elementary school!
